cac:ProcurementLegislationDocumentRefere.cbc:ID: The tender procedure shall be carried in the following way: a. Distribution of the RFP to Bidders; b. Submission of the Bid by Bidders; c. Evaluation of Bids: verification whether the Bid meets technical requirements; d. Evaluation of Bids: comparison of prices for Bids which meet the verification in item 10.5. c; f. Negotiations with Bidders: price negotiations as well as agreeing details of project execution; g. Selection of the Contractor. The best offer as the lowest score, according to the following formula: IRU NRC (€) +15*Maintenance Charges (annual fee) (€)+Facilities all initial costs (€)+180*Facilities (monthly costs) (€) (IRU NRC’s (€) share in TOTAL OFFER PRICE must be above 65%). h. Signing of the Agreement.
cac:ProcurementLegislationDocumentRefere.cbc:DocumentDescription: Internal procedure of the ordering party
Internal procedure of the ordering party

cac:SpecificTendererRequirement.cbc:Description: Obligations of the Vendor / Contractor to comply with the Rules of Ethical Behavior of Vendors in Contacts with Netia S.A. Group – Signed on the template which constitutes Appendix no. 3 to RFP.
Obligations of the Vendor / Contractor to comply with the Rules of Ethical Behavior of Vendors in Contacts with Netia S.A. Group – Signed on the template which constitutes Appendix no. 3 to RFP.

cac:TenderingProcess.cbc:Description: a) All Bidders are bound by the same terms of tender procedure, according to internal procedures of Netia. b) The Bidder shall be obliged to keep confidential any information concerning Netia, obtained in connection with participation in this tender procedure, in particular information which constitutes trade secret in the understanding of Article 11 item 4 of the Act on counteracting unfair competition (Journal of Laws, of 8 June 1993, no. 47, Item 211, as amended). c) This Request for Proposal constitutes an invitation to negotiations in the understanding of Article 72 of the Civil Code, thus the provisions concerning the offer in the understanding of Article 66 i of new Civil Code. d) Nevertheless, the Parties exclude an automatic effect of placing an order (that is a moment when the Parties will reach an agreement regarding any and all provisions that were subject of negotiations), whereas placing of an order takes place at the moment of signing it by both Parties.

a) All Bidders are bound by the same terms of tender procedure, according to internal procedures of Netia b) The Bidder shall be obliged to keep confidential any information concerning Netia, obtained in connection with participation in this tender procedure, in particular information which constitutes trade secret in the understanding of Article 11 item 4 of the Act on counteracting unfair competition (Journal of Laws, of 8 June 1993, no. 47, Item 211, as amended). c) This Request for Proposal constitutes an invitation to negotiations in the understanding of Article 72 of the Civil Code, thus the provisions concerning the offer in the understanding of Article 66 i of new Civil Code. d) Nevertheless, the Parties exclude an automatic effect of placing an order (that is a moment when the Parties will reach an agreement regarding any and all provisions that were subject of negotiations), whereas placing of an order takes place at the moment of signing it by both Parties.

cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: Provision of a Dark Fibre IRU and Ancillary Services
Provision of a Dark Fibre IRU and Ancillary Services
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description: Netia would like to ask potential bidders (“Bidders”) to prepare a Bid with respect to Provision of a Dark Fibre IRU and Ancillary Services, according to the requirements listed RFP, in particular according to the specification described in Item 4 of the RFP.

Netia would like to ask potential bidders (“Bidders”) to prepare a Bid with respect to Provision of a Dark Fibre IRU and Ancillary Services, according to the requirements listed RFP, in particular according to the specification described in Item 4 of the RFP.
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Note: a) The Bid shall be complete and include all required explanations, attachments and proposals of the Bidder, indicated in his Bid. By presenting the Bid in the form which is not consistent with provisions of this document or after the set deadline, the Bidder assumes the risk of omitting his Bid during the final selection of the Bidder. The Bidder shall cover any expenses related to providing a reply to RFP. b) Failure to deliver all required information or delivering the Bid after the set deadline shall mean the lack of willingness to participate in the tender procedure at the Bidder’s own accord. Failure to meet the terms of RFP by the Bidder shall entitle Netia to reject the Bid. Netia reserves the right to: a) amend, update or adjust the schedule, technical scope to its own current needs or requirements. b) accept the Bid in full or in part, to reject it, to exclude the Bidder from the tender procedure as well as cancel the tender procedure without providing any reasons. In such a case the Bidders shall not be entitled to any claims against Netia. If the tender procedure is cancelled, the Bidders will be notified about this fact in writing. c) reject the Bid in case of the failure to deliver all required information or delivery of the Bid after the set deadline, which means the lack of willingness to participate in the tender procedure by the Bidder’s own accord. d) select any entity/entities with whom the negotiations will be conducted with respect to a part or the entire scope of the submitted Bids and to conclude an Agreement with more than one Bidder selected through negotiations, whereas the scope of the Agreement can cover a part or the entire scope of the submitted response to the Request for Proposal. e) cancel the process of Bidder’s selection and/or withdraw from negotiations. On this account the Bidder shall not be entitled to any claims against the Contracting Authority.

The Bidder shall cover any expenses related to providing a reply to RFP. b) Failure to deliver all required information or delivering the Bid after the set deadline shall mean the lack of willingness to participate in the tender procedure at the Bidder’s own accord. Failure to meet the terms of RFP by the Bidder shall entitle Netia to reject the Bid. Netia reserves the right to: a) amend, update or adjust the schedule, technical scope to its own current needs or requirements. b) accept the Bid in full or in part, to reject it, to exclude the Bidder from the tender procedure as well as cancel the tender procedure without providing any reasons. In such a case the Bidders shall not be entitled to any claims against Netia. If the tender procedure is cancelled, the Bidders will be notified about this fact in writing. c) reject the Bid in case of the failure to deliver all required information or delivery of the Bid after the set deadline, which means the lack of willingness to participate in the tender procedure by the Bidder’s own accord. d) select any entity/entities with whom the negotiations will be conducted with respect to a part or the entire scope of the submitted Bids and to conclude an Agreement with more than one Bidder selected through negotiations, whereas the scope of the Agreement can cover a part or the entire scope of the submitted response to the Request for Proposal. e) cancel the process of Bidder’s selection and/or withdraw from negotiations. On this account the Bidder shall not be entitled to any claims against the Contracting Authority.

cac:ProcessJustification.cbc:Description: A complete Bid, including all documents listed in Item 5 of RFP, shall be sent in one e-mail to e-mail addresses provided in Item 3. The Bid shall be signed by persons authorized to represent the Bidder. Powers of attorney must be attached to the Bid. A document in PDF format (in case of more files, they can be compressed in ZIP file) is the required form of reply.
